result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin K Brierly was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Violate/Harassment Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.125(7).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Justin K Brierly in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def has applied for SPD and Dean counsel and been turned down on both; Court questions def re status of counsel. Def states he's talked with the DA and she has offer a year probation. Waiver forms completed. Court conducts counsel waiver and plea waiver colloquies with def. Def pleads guilty to Count 1. Court dismisses Count 2. Further colloquy on Count 1. Finding of guilty. Court asks for victim input. DA states there is no input; notes the injunction was in a Sauk County case filed in 2015; notes charges that were dismissed. Court notes lack of victim input, dismissed charges, etc. Sentence: $200 plus costs, 60 dtp. Total, with surcharges, is $1005.
From DA's office to the Court - withdrawing the warrant requested yesterday

No contact with victim named in the complaint.

2:40 p.m. Defendant Justin K Brierly in court without counsel. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Matter was called earlier today but request for bond was not made. DA is asking for $500 sig bond - no contact with victim named in complaint. So ordered. Next court date has already been set.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 26, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

Def failed-to-appear at yesterday's hearing.  He showed today to DA's office, thinking the hearing was to be held today.  Case was called at 1:57pm.  Defendant Justin K Brierly in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. State asks that WA be quashed.  So ordered.  State says that if def wants to waive his rights to counsel, she may be able to make an offer. Def agrees, and waives his right to an atty.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 26, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
1:57 p.m. Defendant Justin K Brierly not in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. DA requests warrant. So ordered.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 29, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney - denied due to lack of indigency (clerk relayed this information in vmail to the def)

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Justin K Brierly in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def waives formal reading of charges. Court states charges and informs def of max possible penalties and right to counsel. Def states he's been in contact with Public Defender's office and waiting for a response. If the def does not qualify for a Public Defender, the court will appoint an atty.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 1, 2017 at 01:30 pm.
